H0.text: Chemical energy is the form of energy produced in the greatest amount by pedaling a bicycle down the sidewalk.

H1.text: Radiant is the form of energy produced in the greatest amount by pedaling a bicycle down the sidewalk, as riding a bicycle generates several forms of energy.

H2.text: Kinetic energy is produced in the greatest amount by pedaling a bicycle down the sidewalk.

H3.text: Sound is the form of energy produced in the greatest amount when pedaling a bicycle down the sidewalk, as riding a bicycle generates several forms of energy.

A4.text: Kinetic energy is determined by the movement of an object – or the composite motion of the object's components – while potential energy reflects the potential of an object to have motion, generally being based upon the object's position within a field or what is stored within the field itself.

A5.text: Only a tiny fraction of the original chemical energy is used for work: gain in kinetic energy of a sprinter during a 100 m race: 4 kJ
